private_information: You can move only these disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
You must follow Tower of Hanoi rules
You can move exactly one disk at a time and only the top disk of any peg
agent_1.goal: Collaborate to achieve the specified Tower of Hanoi goal configuration while respecting agent-specific disk permissions and the standard rules.

private_information: You can move only these disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O
You must follow Tower of Hanoi rules
You can move exactly one disk at a time and only the top disk of any peg
agent_2.goal: Collaborate to achieve the specified Tower of Hanoi goal configuration while respecting agent-specific disk permissions and the standard rules.

private_information: Coordinate agents and synthesize the final multi-agent PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the audited move list into a coherent multi-agent planning model and output final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward solver.

private_information: Audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed moves
Remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as tokens or penalties that do not correspond to primitive actions
Enforce agent disk-permission constraints and Tower of Hanoi rules strictly
auditor.goal: Validate and, if necessary, minimally edit the agents’ proposed moves so that the final ordered list is legal, causally consistent, and achieves the goal configuration.

init.label_size_order: A is the smallest, O is the largest
rules: Only one disk may be moved at a time
A move consists of taking the top disk from one peg and placing it on top of another peg
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agents may only move disks they are authorized to handle

public_information: Two-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Agent move permissions are restricted: agent_1 can move A through H, agent_2 can move I through O
Initial configuration: left peg has from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg has from top to bottom F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has from top to bottom A, B, D, E; right peg has from top to bottom C
Tower of Hanoi rules must be obeyed at all times and agent disk-permission constraints must never be violated

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk D from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk E from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk C from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk D from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
notes: All moves obey Tower of Hanoi rules and agent_1 permissions
No moves require agent_2 since only disks A through E are manipulated
End state matches the requested goal configuration exactly

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are a cooperative Tower of Hanoi planner representing agent_1. You propose only primitive moves for disks you are authorized to move and always respect Tower of Hanoi rules and causal correctness. Do not emit PDDL; emit only primitive moves if asked.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your permissions and knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Propose a consistent subsequence of primitive moves you can perform, in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include disks you are authorized to move.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are a cooperative Tower of Hanoi planner representing agent_2. You propose only primitive moves for disks you are authorized to move and always respect Tower of Hanoi rules and causal correctness. Do not emit PDDL; emit only primitive moves if asked.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your permissions and knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Propose a consistent subsequence of primitive moves you can perform, in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include disks you are authorized to move.

audit_moves.system_prompt: You audit and reconcile multiple candidate move sequences into a single temporally and causally consistent plan. You remove bookkeeping shortcuts and any constructs that are not primitive moves. You enforce Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permission constraints strictly.
audit_moves.prompt: You receive candidate move sets from the two agents: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Using the public information {environment->public_information} and the initial and goal configurations {environment->init->initial} and {environment->init->goal}, produce a single ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal. Ensure that every move is legal, that only authorized agents move their allowed disks, and that the final configuration exactly matches the goal. Output moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling for the FastDownward solver. You produce a final PDDL domain and problem that capture two agents with agent-specific move actions, the three pegs, disk sizes and ordering constraints, the initial configuration, and the exact goal configuration. Always enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. The model must be compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: Synthesize a multi-agent PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that model the audited primitive move plan {audited_moves} and the Tower of Hanoi environment described in {environment->public_information} with initial state {environment->init->initial} and goal state {environment->init->goal}. Ensure actions are typed and agent-scoped where appropriate, encode size constraints so larger disks cannot be placed on smaller disks, and ensure the problem is solvable. Output only the PDDL domain and problem enclosed in the required tags.
